content.description: This is a short, overhanging, tight hands/loose fingers, to tips crack.
content.location: This is on the same side of the river as ?Continuity?, across the valley to the EAST. SEE PIC. At the bottom left side of the rock, there is a big, overhanging block, Mui Bajo is on the east face of the big block.

content.description: The only PERFECT splitter I've ever climbed in the BTC, in a nice, left-facing dihedral. The lower portion of the crack is small hands and a crimp or two leading to a 2 foot ledge in the middle of the route. The last 20 feet is large hands and a jug to large fists at the top.  Fun, just not long enough!
content.protection:
#6 TCU, #2 Camalot, #3.5 Camalot.

Bring a long (3 foot) sling, a big horn is up top for an anchor. As well as a finger sized crack.
content.location: Right (NW) of ?Continuity? about 20 yards, scramble up the hillside to the base of the crack. You can't miss it.
